item.title: Democrats seek a businesslike image; many in GOP decry effect on families
item.dc:creator: Brian Kirsten
item.content:encoded:
Forget the minimum wage. Or outsourcing jobs overseas. The labor issue most on the minds of members of Congress yesterday was their own: They will have to work five days a week starting in January. The horror. Rep. Steny H. Hoyer, the Maryland Democrat who will become House majority leader and is writing the schedule for the next Congress, said members should expect longer hours than the brief week they have grown accustomed to.
Read the whole article.
